Posts.Content: I too have good news to share. Bone and CT scan clear. Not had snb results as yet but would expect they will be positive as tumour large. We are over the moon so there is now hope at last. Chemo starts 31st the dreaded Tax not sure how many will be 4 if node clear or 6 if not then MX. Hope everybody else gets a little Christmas cheer feels so much worse this time of year Hugs Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: I too have good news to share. Bone and CT scan clear. Not had snb results as yet but would expect they will be positive as tumour large. We are over the moon so there is now hope at last. Chemo starts 31st the dreaded Tax not sure how many will be 4 if node clear or 6 if not then MX. Hope everybody else gets a little Christmas cheer feels so much worse this time of year Hugs Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: Hi I was exactly the same on day 5 with Tax was ok before that and also after just completely bowled me over on that day. Wendy
Posts.Title: Day 5 after chemo

Posts.Content: Off to get my first Tax today mixed into a lovely potion with C - can't wait. Should only have 4 providing it shrinks the tumour so fingers crossed. Will be counting them off. Wendy
Posts.Title: First Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Has anybody had a nipple sparing Mx with Immediate recon ? Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Nipple sparing Mx

Posts.Content: Hi I am very similar also have 48mm tumour diagnosed last week. Have some pain but think it is probably from biopsy. I do have pain in other places but think it is my mind going mad with imagining the worst. I am starting chemo on 31st to shrink before surgery although when I saw oncologist on Weds they think surgery first so they have to discuss again. Let us know how you are doing and if yo get any answers always here to listen Wendy
Posts.Title: Lump pain

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Easy for me to say I know but think you have to put trust in your oncologist and believe that this chemo is going to zap the b*****d. You are in their hands and they will be doing the very best for you . How did thy discover your secondaries did they scan you ? They can only quote statistics and they are from some years ago and treatments have come a long way so you will get through this ( although tough) and have many a happy year with your children. So deep breath and chin up and let battle commence fight it for those kids and you. Thinking of you Wendy x x
Posts.Title: its spread so scared

Posts.Content: Jane I am south Lincs in Deeping St James just about on the Cambs border Wendy
Posts.Title: reconstruction surgery advice

Posts.Content: Jane I am in Lincolnshire also. Where abouts are you ? Wendy x
Posts.Title: reconstruction surgery advice

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzie I am having Docetaxel and cyclophos had first one just over 2 weeks ago due 2nd on Monday providing bloods ok. I have found in really good apart from day 5 when I was off my feet. I have had some SE but minor ones such as achy legs , constipation, heartburn but all ok with a few pills. The Docetaxel is talked about on here as the dreaded Tax but so far I found it ok people very rarely tell you the good things only the horror stories and just hope it is ok for you. Hope all goes well x x
Posts.Title: Any comments/help appreciated

Posts.Content: Hi Diane I used a shampoo from Boots called Naked. Kept my hair but cold cap has to fit tight. Wendy
Posts.Title: A Cold cap - did it work for you?

Posts.Content: Hi Debbie Think you will find this is normal I had 5 nodes removed 14 years ago and still slightly numb under that arm like Dorothee says it is to do with what they disturb when they are doing surgery. Wishing you luck with your journey looks like it has been caught early. Wendy x x
Posts.Title: numb feeling under arm after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Lynne I have had 3 of 4 just the T (docetaxol) plus cyclophos and used cold cap. I still have my hair and o Last one tomorrow. There is a 20% success rate with tax so worth a try Wendy
Posts.Title: Waiting....and waiting.... doesn't it cause more stress?

Posts.Content: Hi Dawn There is a very useful website called cancerhaircare wish I had found it when I first started with the cold cap . There is a section on cold cap which says you can colour 3-6 weeks after last chemo. The info had come via the Lister hospital. I have used the cold cap twice and worked for me both times. Like you I have thinned on top and have a wider parting but well worth the hassle. Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Need some advice re. Hair growth etc

Posts.Content: Gail I have had 3 tax so far and been good days 4 and 5 are the worst for me just very tired. I think if you are going to get a reaction it happens in the first few mins and they will be on standby for this. I don't think it happens that often so wouldn't worry. Hope you got your wig sorted on 6th and feel like you are now getting through your poison cycles fingers crossed everything is doing its job Love Wendy x x
Posts.Title: End of FEC Taxotare in 2 weeks. What to expect?

Posts.Content: Assume fairly soon after appointment next week with surgeon to discuss and hopefully get a timescale or even a date Wendy
Posts.Title: End of FEC Taxotare in 2 weeks. What to expect?

Posts.Content: Lynne Think I may have replied to you another post. Have had 3 of 4 tax with cold cap and kept my hair. if has a 20% success rate on tax so well worth. Sorry if I am repeating myself just got bak from a weekend away and loads of posts Wendy x
Posts.Title: Cold cap? any advice

Posts.Content: Lynne Think I may have replied to you another post. Have had 3 of 4 tax with cold cap and kept my hair. if has a 20% success rate on tax so well worth. Sorry if I am repeating myself just got bak from a weekend away and loads of posts Wendy x
Posts.Title: Cold cap? any advice

Posts.Content: Lynne I used cold cap 14 years ago when they we new on the market and it worked for me. Onc told me a that time that I was a waste of time and wouldn't work but t did. Thinned a little but never had to wear a hat etc. I am Docetaxel this time and having my third one on Monday and still have my hair using cold cap . I am even going for a hair cut today. ( hope I haven't jinxed it ) I know it is well worth a try. It is not for everyone but if you don't try you don't know. Hope all goes well for you Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Cold cap? any advice

Posts.Content: Hope you are both doing ok and being looked after. Think we are better off at home in our n surroundings. Rebecca - have you had another expander in ? You have answered to several of my posts regarding reconstruction and have even really helpful. I have my op on 25th April and will be bi-lateral MX not sure on recon as yet but think maybe expander on good side but surgeon does not really want to do recon on BC side as have to have rads. Will discuss next weds with him to finalise. Wishing you both a speedy recovery. X x
Posts.Title: Had MX, wish I had stayed in over night

Posts.Content: There was a article in The Sun at weekend if anybody interested I reding can find it on their website Wendy
Posts.Title: PERJETA - new drug With potentially better results than herceptin

Posts.Content: Kelly know how you feel the thoughts that go through your head can be awful and you just can't help it. A you get further on I think you will find that it is not at forefront of our thoughts 24/7 but know that will be a little time coming. What chemo did you have ? Hugs Wendy
Posts.Title: Not great news

Posts.Content: Hi all I am after opinions on recovery after mastectomy I know everybody is different. I might be having mastectomy with immediate reconstruction - possibly silicon implant - after my 4th Tax which is 5th March so hopefully end of March. Will be seeing breast surgeon in next 3 weeks to discuss but just wanted opinions on recovery time after. There will be no lymph node surgery. The reason I need info is my daughter gets married 20th April and want to be reasonably ok for that date Thanks Wendy
Posts.Title: Recovery after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Kiera brilliant news x x
Posts.Title: Back to hospital

Posts.Content: Hope it goes ok and they sort you out. Let us know Hugs Wendy x x
Posts.Title: Back to hospital
